pr_title: [FLINK-17084][table] Implement input type inference and output type strategy for ARRAY/ROW/MAP built-in functions

timeline.message:
[FLINK-17084][table] Implement input type inference and output type
strategy for ARRAY/ROW/MAP built-in functions

The type strategies are implemented using the new type stack. It also
removes those three planner expressions from the Blink planner as they
are no longer needed. Equivalent expressions in flink planner are not
yet removed as they are needed for converting to RexNodes.

It disables the FunctionDefinitionConvertRule for built-in functions as
the BridgingSqlFunction call generator supports only user defined functions so far.

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -59,6 +57,11 @@ *
  • BuiltinFunctionDefinitions.FLATTEN

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/flink-table/flink-table-api-java/src/test/java/org/apache/flink/table/utils/FunctionLookupMock.java b/flink-table/flink-table-api-java/src/test/java/org/apache/flink/table/utils/FunctionLookupMock.java index d456862610b..765ba33078e 100644 --- a/flink-table/flink-table-api-java/src/test/java/org/apache/flink/table/utils/FunctionLookupMock.java +++ b/flink-table/flink-table-api-java/src/test/java/org/apache/flink/table/utils/FunctionLookupMock.java @@ -59,7 +59,7 @@ import java.util.stream.Collectors; * *

Built-in functions that use the Flink's type inference stack: *

    - *
  • BuiltinFunctionDefinitions.ROW<
    • + *
  • BuiltinFunctionDefinitions.ROW
    • *
* *

This class supports only a simplified identifier parsing logic. It does not support escaping.

timeline.bodyText: nit: on one hand it is nice to hide this but on the other hand it spams the current package and org.apache.flink.table.types.inference.strategies should be the right location.
timeline.author: twalthr

timeline.bodyText: nit: how about we just use the class name of input strategy by default
timeline.author: twalthr
